name: Backward Arm Circles
how_to_perform:
1. Stand in a neutral position with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms relaxed by your sides. Make sure to maintain good posture throughout the exercise.
2. Hold your arms straight out from your body, palms facing upwards.
3. Keeping your upper arms still, rotate your forearms so that your hands are moving in a circle behind you.
4. Continue moving your hands in a large circular motion, keeping your upper arm and torso still, for the desired number of repetitions. Change directions after completing full circles by switching to forward-facing palms.
short_summary: Backward Arm Circles work multiple muscles across the upper body.
